DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : Primary - Evaluate efficacy magnesium oxide hot flash woman history breast cancer . Secondary - Evaluate side-effect profile magnesium oxide study population . - Evaluate effect magnesium oxide secondary outcome hot flash frequency , hot flash severity , toxicity ( include diarrhea ) , hot flash-related daily interference activity . - Evaluate effect magnesium oxide change magnesium level ( first 150 patient ) . OUTLINE : This multicenter study . Patients stratify accord age ( 18-49 year vs ≥ 50 year ) , current tamoxifen and/or selective estrogen receptor modulator ( yes v ) , current aromatase inhibitor ( yes v ) , daily frequency hot flash ( 4-9 v ≥ 10 ) . Patients randomize 1 4 treatment arm . - Arm I : Patients receive low-dose magnesium oxide orally ( PO ) daily ( QD ) . - Arm II : Patients receive high-dose magnesium oxide PO QD . - Arm III : Patients receive low-dose placebo PO QD . - Arm IV : Patients receive high-dose placebo PO QD . In arm , treatment continue 8 week absence unacceptable toxicity . Some patient may continue crossover receive magnesium 4 week . Patients complete Hot Flash Diary daily 9 week begin 1 week treatment . They also complete Symptom Experience Questionnaire , Profile Mood States ( POMS ) , Hot Flash-Related Daily Interference Scale ( HFRDIS ) questionnaires periodically study treatment . Patients undergo blood sample collection baseline end week 5 9 serum magnesium level analysis .
